newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stock index futures finish strongly higher.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stock index futures finish strongly higher.

text.p: U.S. stock index futures ended strongly higher, buoyed by technical bullishness and spillover Treasury bond strength.
September Standard & Poor's 500 futures posted a fresh record high at 960.30, wiping out the old all-time peak set Friday at 951.75.

"Stay long and you'll be OK in the end, just stay with it," an S&P 500 futures trader said during the session. "It just keeps rallying -- it's pretty technically bullish." He said the market's near-term uptrend remains healthy even if September pulls back to 951.00.
Traders said the market could turn a bit edgy heading into significant data later this week, but until a surprise shakes things loose, the upward trend should continue, they said.
Any dips will likely attract buyers, they added.
Second-quarter gross-domestic product is due Thursday and July jobs data on Friday.
A Reuters poll of economists showed an average estimated for GDP at 1.9 percent. July jobs were forecast up 193,000, versus a 217,000 June gain.
The jobless rate was seen at 4.9 percent, down from 5.0 in the previous report.
Traders said action was only light to moderate in afternoon trade. They said a 1,000-lot offer in September S&Ps at 957.50 stymied gains in the last 20 minutes of trade.
At the close, Sept S&P 500s were up 10.15 pts to 957.15, Nikkei fell 190.0 pts to 20,300.0, Midcap 400s rose 4.85 to 315.85, Russell rose 4.40 to 417.00, and NASDAQ rose 13.25 to 1109.25.
